channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Shockingly bad jobs report reveals a months-long stall and may trigger Fed rate cuts soon. ‘Powell is going to regret holding rates steady’
item.description: "September is a lock for a rate cut and it might even be a 50-basis point move to make up the lost time."

item.title: Stocks dive as job numbers disappoint and tariff ‘panic’ sets in
item.description: Trump, meanwhile, continues to beat the drum against Fed chair Jerome Powell.

item.title: Trump rips into ‘stubborn’ Jerome Powell, calls for Fed’s board to launch a coup and seize power
item.description: If Powell doesn't “substantially” lower rates, Trump said, “THE BOARD SHOULD ASSUME CONTROL, AND DO WHAT EVERYONE KNOWS HAS TO BE DONE!”

item.title: The share of female CEOs running Global 500 companies hits a record high of 6.6%
item.description: Thirty-three Global 500 companies have female CEOs.

item.title: China’s plan to stop Elon Musk’s Starlink includes submarines that can shoot lasers into space
item.description: Supply-chain sabotage and custom-built attack satellites armed with ion thrusters are others strategies Chinese scientists have been developing, an AP...

item.title: Amazon’s stock is falling, as this trend from earnings has investors worried
Exxon Mobil, Chevron say oil production is booming and they’re rolling in cash
Investors will be watching the jobs report for signals about the Fed's next step
July jobs report shows unemployment rising, jobs market eroding
Dow drops 500 points, Treasury yields slide after weak July jobs report
